instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Hi everyone.

Dealing with this board that does not display, but fan is spinning, battery is dead. Battery replaced, same issue.
It had battery replaced a few months ago.
It will sometimes not power on and missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.

99% of the time when it's on and no display, it will have all the voltages present from Power Aliases, but not the LCDBKLT Rail.
Tested on external and a good working screen, no display.
No USB activity.
Please, any idea where I should check next?
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE for sure?
What about <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> in that moment?
Also check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> voltage on pins 7 & 3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Powering the board without battery <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes to 8.59V
With battery fan spinning and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes to 7.89V.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 3.32V
VCORE - 1.74V

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>
Pin 1 - 3.32V
Pin 2 - 3.32V
Pin 3 - 3.42V
Pin 4 - GND
Pin 5 - 3.42V
Pin 6 - 3.42V
Pin 7 -3.42V

All resistors from SPI is ok.
I replaced SPI rom just in case and same scenario. (Original SPI Rom soldered back)

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Try heating CPU with quality flux.
In case of accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
This skipped from my measurements.
I removed L7630, and it measures very low resistance to ground on  <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_REG_R</SIGNAL>.
--------------------------------------
L7630 removed.
In diode mode
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_REG_R</SIGNAL> - 0.017
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> - 0.177
---------------------------------------
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_REG_R</SIGNAL> - 0.13Ω
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> - 0.177Ω

Do you think that this is beyond repair?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No display - Fan spinning. Sometimes missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
0.017 in diode mode is somewhere between 15-20 ohm.
0.13 ohm is pure short, as 0.177 ohm too; 130 miliohm and 177 miliohm respectively.
Please, read the multimeter correctly; you've probably forgot a "K".

However, PCH coil should give a reading 0.100 aprox (diode mode); 90-120 in ohm scale.
So 0.017 (diode mode) is too low; compare with good board.
